flawed_nl_solution:
Mark has 10 fewer cards than Michael so Mark has 100 cards - 10 cards = 60 cards.
So, Lloyd has 60 cards / 3 = <<60/3=20>>20 cards.
All three of them have 60 cards + 20 cards + 100 cards = <<60+20+100=180>>180 cards.
Thus, they need to collect 300 cards - 180 cards = <<300-180=120>>120 more cards.
#### 120

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 90, not 60. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
